description.para: Individual quantities are represented as a variable of this type. A combination of quantities is an ored list of Quantity_t, e.g.
To check wheter a given quantity is listed in a Quantity_t variable quant: if(quant&GYOTOQUANTITY_EMISSION)...
List of all possible Quantity_t individual values and the corresponding string (see Gyoto::Scenery) with corresponding XML name:

briefdescription.para: MinDistance: Behaves like minimal distance between Photon and Astrobj.

detaileddescription.para: Not always exactly a distance, though.

briefdescription.para: FirstDmin: First Photon-Astrobj distance local minimum while integrating back in time.
ImpactCoords: Astrobj and Photon 8-coordinates at emission.

detaileddescription.para: A 16-element vector. See Gyoto::Quantity_t.

briefdescription.para: Spectrum: I at each frequency in Scenery::screen_->getMidpoints().
Spectrum: 12I d in each frequency channel in Scenery::screen_.
NbCrossEqPlane: number of equatorial plane crossings.
Bitwise or of all spectral quantities.
Bitwise or of all the Stokes parameters.

description.para: Controling which messages are shown to the user

The user should be able to choose which messages are shown to her. In Gyoto, this is determined by a user-settable verbosity level (see Gyoto::verbose()) and a user-settable debug mode (see Goyto::debug()).
The following macros define various debug and verbosity level and provide short-cuts to display formatted messages only at a given verbosity level or in debug mode.

detaileddescription.para: Only very few messages may be output to stdout at this level.
Use GYOTO_QUIET to display messages at this level.
Severe warning messages are output to stderr if Gyoto::verbose()GYOTO_SEVERE_VERBOSITY.
Use GYOTO_SEVERE to display messages at this level.
Warning messages are output to stderr if Gyoto::verbose()GYOTO_WARNING_VERBOSITY.
Use GYOTO_WARNING to display messages at this level.
Normal messages are output to stdout if Gyoto::verbose()GYOTO_DEFAULT_VERBOSITY.
Use GYOTO_MSG to display messages at this level.
Informative messages are output to stderr if Gyoto::verbose()GYOTO_INFO_VERBOSITY.
Use GYOTO_INFO to display messages at this level.
In debug mode, all messages are displayed in addition to specific debug information.
To display debug messages, check GYOTO_DEBUG_MODE or use GYOTO_DEBUG for instance.

briefdescription.para: Display a message to stdout even in quiet mode.

detaileddescription.para: Only very few messages may be output to stdout at this level. This should be reserved to messages shown at most once in a run.

briefdescription.para: Display a severe level message to stderr.
Display a warning level message to stderr.

detaileddescription.para: The message will by default be shown to the user. To be reserved to messages shown at most once per Gyoto::Screen row.
Message will be shown to the user only if Gyoto::verbose() has been explicitely raised.

memberdef.name: GYOTO_WARNING_UDUNITS
memberdef.initializer: GYOTO_WARNING << "unit ignored (trying to convert from \"" << from \ << "\" to " \ << to \ << "\"), you may have more chance recompiling Gyoto with --with-udunits\n"

briefdescription.para: Unit ignored because libudunits2 was disabled.

detaileddescription.para: Use this warning when a conversion has been dropped due to HAVE_UDUNITS being undefined.

briefdescription.para: Output expression value in debug mode.

memberdef.name: GYOTO_DEBUG_ARRAY
memberdef.initializer: if (GYOTO_DEBUG_MODE) { \ std::cerr << "DEBUG: " << __PRETTY_FUNCTION__ << ": " \ << #a << "=[" << a[0] ; \ for (size_t _gyoto_debug_array_i=1; _gyoto_debug_array_i < n; ++_gyoto_debug_array_i) \ std::cerr << "," << a[_gyoto_debug_array_i] ; \ std::cerr << "]" << std::endl ;}

briefdescription.para: Output array content in debug mode.

parameterdescription.para: Number of elements to show (array must be at least this size).

detaileddescription.para: Message is prepended with the word "DEBUG:" and the signature of the function.
Message is displayed only if GYOTO_DEBUG_MODE is true and is prepended with the word "DEBUG:" and the signature of the function.
Code between GYOTO_IF_DEBUG and GYOTO_ENDIF_DEBUG is only executed in debug mode.
Code between GYOTO_IF_DEBUG and GYOTO_ENDIF_DEBUG is only executed in debug mode.

description.para: Every Gyoto::Metric has a coordinate system kind. It can be used by functions which need to express coordinates always in spherical or always in Cartesian form, with trivial conversion between the two.

briefdescription.para: Default size for arrays in a Worldline.
Default value for the initial step in the integration loop.

detaileddescription.para: Since the step is (most of the time) adaptive, this default only has little influence, but sometimes, it matters. Also used in Scenery.

briefdescription.para: Default value for the maximum step in the integration loop.
Default value for the minimum step in the integration loop.

detaileddescription.para: For investigations close to the event horizon, 0.5 is usually fine. If high accuracy is needed long after deflection (weak lensing), then this must be smaller. A good test is to look at a MinDistance map for a FixedStar: it must be smooth.

briefdescription.para: Precision on the determination of a date.

detaileddescription.para: E.g. in Gyoto::Photon::findMin(), Gyoto::Photon::findValue().

briefdescription.para: Field width when outputting double values.
Default list of default plug-ins to load...
Celerity of light squared c^2 in cgs.
Inverse of celerity of light squared in cgs.
ideal gas constant R in SI
ideal gas constant R in erg/(K mol)
Factor to convert I from c.g.s. to SI.
Factor to convert J from c.g.s. to SI.
Factor to convert alpha from c.g.s. to SI.

description.para: Define GYOTO_NO_DEPRECATED to disable these macros and the warning. For instance: makeCPPFLAGS=-DGYOTO_NO_DEPRECATED

detaileddescription.para:
If HAVE_SINCOS is undefined, Gyoto provides a trivial implementation.
t
Angle in radian;
s
Adress where sin(t) should be stored;
c
Adress where cos(t) should be stored.
